marginalia.translation: More of the spirits of lively and animate creatures.

position.marginalia_text: An howre enowghe for a good frend: halfe an howr,
too much for a good fellow.
( Animus est entelechia. Ingenium, ( quinta essentia.

marginalia.translation: Mind is actualization. Genius, the fifth essence.
Nothing is ever elevated or rectified enough.
Speech is as if a serene light of the soul.

position.marginalia_text: Nullus Oratorum adhuc, aut Poetaru[m] Axiophilo satisfecit. Qui esse voluit non modò ratione, arte, virtute plenior: sed etiam rotundior, fluentior, penetrantior: sed vita, spirituq[ue] animosior. Vt nihil viuidius, aut valentius.

marginalia.translation: No orator or poet has yet satisfied Axiophilus. He who wanted not only to be fuller of reason, art, and virtue, but also more well-rounded, more fluent, more penetrating. But he is stronger than life or spirit. Just as nothing is more lively or powerful.

position.marginalia_text: The best Orators, or Poets haue sumthing harsh, or cowld. All woold be
illuminate, current, & full of life. As vigorous, as the spirit of Wine; or the most soueraine Aqua Vita[e]. No Cordiall, so mightily cordiall.
